qas.question: A pendant of hair-covered skin that hangs from under the throat of an animal e.g. the moose, is:
The metatarsal and tarsal glands on a deer's outside lower leg are used for:
An ungulate is:
answers: A split-hoofed animal with even toes
A split-hoofed animal that has horns

qas.question: A bovid is:
answers: A common term for the Horned Family
A split-hoofed animal with even toes
An animal that feeds mostly on leaves, twigs and shoots.

qas.question: Antlers are:
answers: A solid bony core that is part of the animal's skull covered by a sheath of hard fibrous horn
Found on both males and females of the bovid species

qas.question: Horns are:
answers: A projection with a solid bony core that is part of the animal's skull covered by a sheath of hard fibrous horn
Found only on the male of the the bovid species
Covered by a hairy skin called 'velvet' during their development

qas.question: Bovid unglulates include:
answers: Mountain goat, thinhorn sheep, bighorn sheep, and bison
Mountain goat, caribou and fallow deer

qas.question: Cervid ungulates include:
answers: Mule deer, fallow deer, whitetail deer, caribou, elk, and moose
Mule deer, fallow deer, whitetail deer, caribou, elk, and mountain goat

qas.question: The two species of thinhorn sheep found in BC are:
Thinhorn Sheep are on average larger than Bighorn Sheep:
Dall's sheep are white, Stone's Sheep are dark:
California and Mountain Bighorn Sheep are found:
answers: In the Southern half of the province

qas.question: Mountain Goats Have:
answers: Larger diameter horns with a uniform curve on billies, smaller diameter horns that are straight with a curved tip on nannies
Whiter colour on billies, darker colour on nannies
Very short horns on nannies, much longer horns on billies

qas.question: To conform to the Hunting Regulations - Hunters are requested to select Billies only
Bison bulls and cows are typically the same size
answers: False - bulls are twice the size of cows
False - bulls are smaller than cows

qas.question: Fallow deer are a non-native species
Black-Tailed deer are found
answers: In the Southern interior of BC
In the Northern interior of BC

qas.question: Mule deer are found
answers: Everywhere in BC East of the Coast Mountains
In the Southern Interior of BC

qas.question: When startled, Mule Deer:
answers: Will run with a high, stiff-legged bounce
Will run with undulating leaps with broad white tails 'flagging'

qas.question: A 4-point Mule Deer:
answers: Has at least 4 tines on at least one side, not including brow tine
Has at least 4 tines on at least one side, including brow tine
Has a total of 4 tines total counting antler tines on both sides, not including brow tine
Has a total of 4 tines total counting antler tines on both sides, including brow tine

qas.question: White-Tailed deer are generally:
answers: Smaller than Mule Deer and larger than Fallow Deer
Smaller than Fallow Deer and larger than Mule Deer
Larger than both Mule Deer and Fallow Deer
Smaller than both Mule Deer and Fallow Deer

qas.question: Both Fallow Deer and Moose have palmated antlers:
Elk live in:
answers: Mountainous areas with habitat as varied as dense coastal forest to semi-open interior forest.

qas.question: Caribou are the only ungulate of which both sexes commonly carry antlers:
Cats have 5 toes on the front foot and 4 on the back foot:
Cougars are found:
answers: Mainly south of the Skeena and Peace Rivers in the Coast Mountains, Interior Plateau, and Rocky Mountans, as ell as Vancouver Island.
Wherever small dogs and children are walked.
In coastal areas of the province and on Vancouver Island.

qas.question: To kill their prey, cougars:
answers: Carefully stalk it, as they are not capable of long chases.
Ambush it from depressons in the earth.

qas.question: A distinctive feature of the cougar is:
answers: It has a long cylindrical tail used for balancing.
It has a black coat in the spring.

qas.question: A distinctive feature of the Lynx is:
answers: It is the smallest of the wild cats in BC.
It's rear legs are shorter than it's front legs.

qas.question: Lynx are found:
answers: Throughout BC East of the coast range.
Only in the Southern part of the province.
Only in the Northern part of the province.

qas.question: A distinctive feature of the bobcat is:
answers: They have small paws, short legs less conspicuous ear tufts than a lynx.
It is the largest of the wild cats in BC.

qas.question: A wolfs tail:
answers: Distinguishes it from a coyote, which has no tail

qas.question: Wolves are found:
answers: Throughout BC with the exception of Haida Gwaii

qas.question: Wolves hunt their prey:
answers: By driving animals toward other wolves

qas.question: Wolves:
answers: Are the largest canid in BC
Are the smallest canid in BC

qas.question: Coyotes can be found:
answers: Throughout BC East of the coastal areas and on the Fraser Delta (not on Vancouver Island or Haida Gwaii)

qas.question: Red Fox are found:
answers: Throughout BC East of the coastal mountains

qas.question: Red Fox are:
answers: The smallest of the canid family, smaller than Coyotes

qas.question: Black Bears can be found:
answers: In the interior, East of the coast mountains
In the coastal islands and West of the coast mountains
Everywhere in BC except the Peace region

qas.question: Black Bears can be distinguished from Grizzly bears by the following characteristics:
answers: Smaller, no shoulder hump, straight face instead of dished
Smaller, has a shoulder hump, and a dished face

qas.question: Grizzly bears can be distinguished from Black Bears by the following characteristics:
answers: Larger, has a shoulder hump, dished face instead of straight
Smaller, no shoulder hump, and a straight face
Grizzly poop has bells in it
